✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

diamonds |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = carat)) +
  geom_density()









diamonds |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = carat)) +
  geom_freqpoly()

`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.










Unexamined life is not worth living!
– Socrates

title: Can.Do.So
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.0     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(ISLR)
library(performance)
library(ggeffects)
library(sjPlot)
library(gtsummary)
library(equatiomatic)
library(report)
set.seed(9)
d <- Wage |> 
  filter(wage < 200 & age < 60) |> 
  sample_n(100, .by = education)
m <- lm(wage ~ age + year + jobclass + education, data = d)
m |> 
  report() |> 
  summary()

We fitted a linear model to predict wage with age, year, jobclass and
education. The model's explanatory power is moderate (R2 = 0.24, adj. R2 =
0.18). The model's intercept is at -1166.82 (95% CI [-6395.29, 4061.65]).
Within this model:

  - The effect of age is statistically significant and positive (beta = 0.87, 95%
CI [0.30, 1.44], t(92) = 3.03, p = 0.003, Std. beta = 0.29)
  - The effect of year is statistically non-significant and positive (beta =
0.61, 95% CI [-2.00, 3.22], t(92) = 0.46, p = 0.644, Std. beta = 0.04)
  - The effect of jobclass [2. Information] is statistically non-significant and
negative (beta = -0.48, 95% CI [-11.26, 10.31], t(92) = -0.09, p = 0.930, Std.
beta = -0.02)
  - The effect of education [2. HS Grad] is statistically non-significant and
positive (beta = 11.50, 95% CI [-6.56, 29.56], t(92) = 1.26, p = 0.209, Std.
beta = 0.40)
  - The effect of education [3. Some College] is statistically significant and
positive (beta = 23.10, 95% CI [5.70, 40.51], t(92) = 2.64, p = 0.010, Std.
beta = 0.80)
  - The effect of education [4. College Grad] is statistically significant and
positive (beta = 30.72, 95% CI [12.98, 48.46], t(92) = 3.44, p < .001, Std.
beta = 1.07)
  - The effect of education [5. Advanced Degree] is statistically significant and
positive (beta = 29.34, 95% CI [6.52, 52.16], t(92) = 2.55, p = 0.012, Std.
beta = 1.02)
m |> 
  report_table()

Parameter                      | Coefficient |              95% CI | t(92) |      p | Std. Coef. | Std. Coef. 95% CI |    Fit
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
(Intercept)                    |    -1166.82 | [-6395.29, 4061.65] | -0.44 | 0.659  |      -0.67 |    [-1.17, -0.17] |       
age                            |        0.87 | [    0.30,    1.44] |  3.03 | 0.003  |       0.29 |    [ 0.10,  0.48] |       
year                           |        0.61 | [   -2.00,    3.22] |  0.46 | 0.644  |       0.04 |    [-0.14,  0.22] |       
jobclass [2. Information]      |       -0.48 | [  -11.26,   10.31] | -0.09 | 0.930  |      -0.02 |    [-0.39,  0.36] |       
education [2. HS Grad]         |       11.50 | [   -6.56,   29.56] |  1.26 | 0.209  |       0.40 |    [-0.23,  1.03] |       
education [3. Some College]    |       23.10 | [    5.70,   40.51] |  2.64 | 0.010  |       0.80 |    [ 0.20,  1.40] |       
education [4. College Grad]    |       30.72 | [   12.98,   48.46] |  3.44 | < .001 |       1.07 |    [ 0.45,  1.68] |       
education [5. Advanced Degree] |       29.34 | [    6.52,   52.16] |  2.55 | 0.012  |       1.02 |    [ 0.23,  1.81] |       
                               |             |                     |       |        |            |                   |       
AIC                            |             |                     |       |        |            |                   | 945.69
AICc                           |             |                     |       |        |            |                   | 947.69
BIC                            |             |                     |       |        |            |                   | 969.14
R2                             |             |                     |       |        |            |                   |   0.24
R2 (adj.)                      |             |                     |       |        |            |                   |   0.18
Sigma                          |             |                     |       |        |            |                   |  26.08

title: Can.Do.So
text:
Check model assumptions visually

check_model(m)







check_normality(m)

OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.234).

check_heteroscedasticity(m)

OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.083).



set.seed(9)
d2 <- Wage |> 
  filter(wage < 200 & age < 60) |> 
  group_by(education) |>
  sample_n(100) |> 
  ungroup()


m2 <- lm(wage ~ age + year + jobclass + education, data = d2)
summary(m2)


Call:
lm(formula = wage ~ age + year + jobclass + education, data = d2)

Residuals:
    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
-96.773 -16.542  -1.439  14.051  69.929 

Coefficients:
                              Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)                 -2127.5724  1134.5286  -1.875   0.0613 .  
age                             0.5601     0.1099   5.095 4.98e-07 ***
year                            1.0916     0.5657   1.930   0.0542 .  
jobclass2. Information          3.3536     2.4528   1.367   0.1722    
education2. HS Grad             6.4143     3.5926   1.785   0.0748 .  
education3. Some College       18.6562     3.6552   5.104 4.76e-07 ***
education4. College Grad       34.3258     3.6994   9.279  < 2e-16 ***
education5. Advanced Degree    45.4886     3.7987  11.975  < 2e-16 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 25.35 on 492 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.3675,    Adjusted R-squared:  0.3585 
F-statistic: 40.84 on 7 and 492 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16



check_model(m2)







check_normality(m2)

Warning: Non-normality of residuals detected (p < .001).

check_heteroscedasticity(m2)

Warning: Heteroscedasticity (non-constant error variance) detected (p < .001).

ggeffect(m2) |> 
  plot() |> 
  sjPlot::plot_grid()

Warning in sjPlot::plot_grid(plot(ggeffect(m2))): Not enough tags labels in
list. Using letters instead.









extract_eq(m2, wrap = T, terms_per_line = 4)
\[
\begin{aligned}
\operatorname{wage} &= \alpha + \beta_{1}(\operatorname{age}) + \beta_{2}(\operatorname{year}) + \beta_{3}(\operatorname{jobclass}_{\operatorname{2.\ Information}})\ + \\
&\quad \beta_{4}(\operatorname{education}_{\operatorname{2.\ HS\ Grad}}) + \beta_{5}(\operatorname{education}_{\operatorname{3.\ Some\ College}}) + \beta_{6}(\operatorname{education}_{\operatorname{4.\ College\ Grad}}) + \beta_{7}(\operatorname{education}_{\operatorname{5.\ Advanced\ Degree}})\ + \\
&\quad \epsilon
\end{aligned}
\]
